actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-762, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2782 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Providing for the consideration of the bill in the Committee of the Whole. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 185.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2782) to amend the Employees Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to provide that such Act does not preempt certain State laws.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2782 (Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and non-preemption of certain State laws).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2782) to amend the Employees Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to provide that such Act does not preempt certain State laws.
